item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 1, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Advent of Code 2024 (603 points | 231 comments)
2. Building a distributed log using S3 (under 150 lines of Go) (21 points | 8 comments)
3. Procedural Knowledge in Pretraining Drives Reasoning in Large Language Models (4 points | discuss)

5. Statistics, by Freedman, Pisani, and Purves (2017) (74 points | 13 comments)
6. Infisical (YC W23) Is Hiring Full Stack Engineers in SF and Remotely ( | hide)
7. First new asthma attack treatment in 50 years (19 points | 1 comment)
8. The Rarest Mineral Is So Rare It's Only Ever Been Found Once (97 points | 19 comments)
9. Ntfs2btrfs does in-place conversion of NTFS filesystem to the open-source Btrfs (348 points | 119 comments)
10. Show HN: Open-source private home security camera system (end-to-end encryption) (350 points | 99 comments)
11. DynaSaur: Large Language Agents Beyond Predefined Actions (97 points | 24 comments)
12. Turning bogs from wastelands to nature-scapes (21 points | 4 comments)
13. AMD Disables Zen 4's Loop Buffer (262 points | 98 comments)
14. How We Optimize LLM Inference for AI Coding Assistant (16 points | 1 comment)
15. Fine, I'll Play With Skiplists (54 points | 7 comments)

17. WinDepends – A Rewrite of the Dependency Walker (125 points | 21 comments)
18. Geometric line-art of Wacław Szpakowski (2017) (427 points | 47 comments)
19. Safe relational database queries using the Rust type system (247 points | 135 comments)
20. The Slang Shading Language (102 points | 34 comments)
21. Who can claim Aristotle? (26 points | 11 comments)
22. Historic Bottle Website (28 points | 2 comments)
23. The Opposite of Documentation is Superstition (2020) (132 points | 63 comments)
24. Tiny Arcades [video] (14 points | discuss)
25. Square roots and maxima (109 points | 32 comments)
26. Caving scientists exploring the darkest places on Earth (51 points | 17 comments)
27. Kubernetes on Hetzner: cutting my infra bill by 75% (22 points | 5 comments)
28. Make the most of your burl (99 points | 38 comments)
29. Interview of Robert Shingledecker, Tiny Core Linux and DSL Developer (2009) (82 points | 29 comments)
30. DELETEs Are Difficult (98 points | 78 comments)
